LanguageData.AlcoholAddiction.label: alcohol addiction
LanguageData.AlcoholAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to alcohol. Long-term presence of alcohol has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug.\n\nWithout regular doses of alcohol, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.AlcoholAddiction.stages.withdrawal.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.label: alcohol
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.description: Alcohol in the bloodstream. It makes people happy, but reduces capacities.
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.warm.label: warm
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.tipsy.label: tipsy
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.drunk.label: drunk
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.hammered.label: hammered
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.blackout.label: blackout
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.label: alcohol tolerance
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to alcohol. The more severe this tolerance is, the more alcohol it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.stages.small.label: small
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.stages.large.label: large
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.stages.massive.label: massive
LanguageData.Hangover.label: hangover
LanguageData.Hangover.description: An unpleasant delayed after-effect of alcohol intoxication.
LanguageData.Hangover.stages.slight.label: slight
LanguageData.Hangover.stages.strong.label: strong
LanguageData.Hangover.stages.pounding.label: pounding
